name: N-(4-ethoxyphenyl)-3,3,3-trifluoro-2-(trifluoromethyl)propanamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3468
Reason: 4-ethoxyphenyl and trifluoromethyl functionalities significantly impact the melting point. The ethoxy group introduces a hydroxyl functional group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by approximately +5°C. The trifluoromethyl group introduces a significant dipole, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +20°C. The ketone group introduces polar carbonyl interactions, contributing approximately +40°C. The presence of these functional groups in N-(4-ethoxyphenyl)-3,3,3-trifluoro-2-(trifluoromethyl)propanamide will affect its melting point: (1) The ethoxy group introduces hydrogen bonding, estimated at approximately +5 degrees Celsius. (2) The trifluoromethyl group introduces a significant dipole, estimated at approximately +20 degrees Celsius. (3) The ketone group introduces polar carbonyl interactions, estimated at approximately +40 degrees Celsius.
